name: wheat stitch™ pumpkin cup cozy
notes:

special offer alert!
add this pattern to your cart to unlock the exclusive discounted price—don’t miss this sale!

❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️

give your coffee cup a taste of sweater weather with the **wheat stitch™ pumpkin cup cozy**! this festive cozy is the perfect quick project for fall and makes a wonderful gift for pumpkin spice lovers, teachers, friends, or anyone who deserves a little handmade happiness.

this pumpkin has options — keep it classic with one cozy orange color, or mix it up with two tones for extra texture. you’ll start by crocheting the body in **[my signature wheat stitch][1]** for a knit-look finish. then, add a join-as-you-go ribbed green top (optional but oh-so-cute!). next, stitch on a pair of simple crochet leaves, and finish it all off with a rustic twine bow. easy, fun, and full of fall vibes!

**bonus** colorwork version included in the full pdf!

perfect for beginners and seasoned crocheters alike, this cozy works up quickly and is a great stash-buster!

[this pattern comes with a video tutorial.][2]

**crochet hook:** 
[g+/7 (4.5mm) - or size to meet gauge][3]

**notions:**
[removable stitch markers][4] 
[yarn needle to weave in ends][5] 
[scissors][6]
[string for tags][7]

**yarn:**
[herrschners worsted 8][8]
100% acrylic, 489yds/226g
shown in clay & leaf

you can also purchase smaller quantities of some colors:
[herrschners worsted 3][9] - 100% acrylic, 183yds/85g

**yarn quantities:**
orange:  50 (60) yds
green: 10 yds

**yarn substitutions:**
[brava worsted][10] - 100% premium acrylic, 218yds/100g
[herrschners village cotton][11] -  60% cotton/40% acrylic blend, 207yds/100g 
[red heart super saver flecks][12] - 96% acrylic/4% other fibers 236yds/141g
[mary maxim maximum value][13] - 474yds/227g

**abbreviations:**
blo- back loop only
ch - chain
flo - front loop only
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

**gauge:**
not critical for this pattern.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post:  [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][14]

**sizes:**
short (tall)

**skill level:**
advanced beginner
